name: source-engine-support
description: Adds support for Source Engine file types and other commands

sourceEngine.captionCompiler.executableP.description: Path to captioncompile.exe for in-editor captions compiling.

sourceEngine.captionCompiler.workingDire.description: Path to the working directory for caption compiler. Should point to the parent directory of the search paths. Falls back to bin dir if empty.

sourceEngine.captionCompiler.openOutputW.description: Re-open the output window on every compile.

sourceEngine.modelCompiler.executablePat.description: Path to studiomdl.exe for in-editor captions compiling.

sourceEngine.modelCompiler.workingDirect.description: Path to the working directory for model compiler. Should point to the parent directory of the search paths. Falls back to bin dir if empty.

sourceEngine.modelCompiler.openOutputWin.description: Re-open the output window on every compile.

sourceEngine.modelCompiler.additionalPar.description: Additional parameters to run while compiling buttons.

sourceEngine.keyvalueBracesOnNewline.description: Whether to put { on a newline after the key

sourceEngine.internalTextures.description: List of internal textures. Includes render-targets and solid colors

default.name: %compilewater
default.description: *[Compiled]* Makes the brush water.

default.name: %compileclip
default.description: *[Compiled]* Makes the brush a clip. Blocks players, and NPCS but **not physics objects**.

default.name: %compiledetail
default.description: *[Compiled]* Any brush using this material will be made func_detail.

default.name: %compileladder
default.description: *[Compiled]* Makes this brush climbable.

default.name: %compilenodraw
default.description: *[Compiled]* The material will not be drawn.

default.name: %compilenolight
default.description: *[Compiled]* Skip compiling lightmaps for this material. Useful for solid black or self-illuminating materials.

default.name: %compilenonsolid
default.description: *[Compiled]* A brush with this material will not have collision.

default.name: %compilenpcclip
default.description: *[Compiled]* Makes the brush an NPC clip. Only NPCs collide with this brush. (Note that Portal 2 security cameras and turrets are NPCs)

default.name: %compilepassbullets
default.description: *[Compiled]* Allows guns to shoot straight through the brush. Useful for grates or foliage

default.name: %compileskip
default.description: *[Compiled]* VBSP will not compile faces using this material. Be careful.

default.name: %compileteam
default.description: *[Compiled]* Compilation modifiers only affect a specific team.

default.name: %compiletrigger
default.description: *[Compiled]* Allows the material to be used for triggers.

default.name: %keywords
default.description: Comma separated list used in Hammer's keyword filter.

default.name: %notooltexture
default.description: Hides the material from Hammer's texture browser

default.name: %noportal
default.description: Compile time parameter to mark this surface as non-portalable. Unnecessary on models.

default.name: %tooltexture
default.description: Defines a texture to use as the thumbnail in Hammer's texture browser

default.name: $basetexture
default.description: The base color texture to use. Also called albedo/diffuse map. On water, this is used as a 'sludge layer'.

default.name: $bumpmap
default.description:
Defines the bump map to use. Despite the name, this actually represents a 3D normal map rather than a 1D height map. 

The [PBR](https://docs.momentum-mod.org/guide/pbr-shader/) shader uses the alpha channel as a height map for parallax occlusion mapping.

default.name: $detail
default.description: Specifies a texture which should be laid over the `$basetexture` when the camera is close up.

default.name: $detailscale
default.description: Scale of the detail texture.

default.name: $detailblendfactor
default.description: How much the detail texture affects the `$basetexture`, like opacity.

default.name: $detailblendmode
default.description:
The detail blend mode to use.

| ID | Blend Mode |
| --- | --- |
| 0 | Decal Modulate |
| 1 | Additive |
| 2 | Translucent Detail |
| 3 | Blend Factor Fade |
| 4 | Translucent Base |
| 5 | Unlit Additive |
| 6 | Unlit Additive Threshold Fade |
| 7 | Two-Pattern DecalModulate |
| 8 | Multiply |
| 9 | Base Mask via Detail Alpha |
| 10 | Self-Shadowed Bumpmap |
| 11 | SSBump Albedo |

default.name: $envmap
default.description: Defines the texture to represent reflections on this material. Use *env_cubemap* to use the nearest cubemap.

default.name: $halflambert
default.description: Enables half-lambertian lighting, which wraps lighting further around a model.

default.name: $ignorez
default.description: Makes the material always appear on top of everything else. Only really used for user-interfaces.

default.name: $model
default.description: Marks the material to be used for models rather than brushes. Also hides it from Hammer's texture browser.

default.name: $nocull
default.description: Disables culling on this material to show the material on both sides of a face.

default.name: $nodecal
default.description: Prevents decals like bullet holes to appear on the material.

default.name: $nofog
default.description: Stops the material from rendering into fog. Used typically for 2D skyboxes.

default.name: $normalmap
default.description:
Defines the normal map to use. Same as `$bumpmap`. 

The [PBR](https://docs.momentum-mod.org/guide/pbr-shader/) shader uses the alpha channel as a height map for parallax occlusion mapping.

default.name: $notint
default.description: Prevents the material from getting tinted by the prop's `rendercolor` or `$color2`.

default.name: $phong
default.description: Enables Phong shading

default.name: $rimlight
default.description: Enables rim-lighting. Requires `$phong 1`.

default.name: $rimlightexponent
default.description: Exponent for phong component of rim lighting. The rim exponent defines the 'tightness' of the highlight. A higher exponent results in a smaller, tighter highlight while a lower exponent results in a broader flatter one.

default.name: $rimlightboost
default.description: Boost for ambient cube component of rim lighting.

default.name: $rimmask
default.description: Uses the alpha channel of the $phongexponenttexture to mask rimlighting.

default.name: $ssbump
default.description:
Enables self-shadowing of the bumpmap. 
Tip: You can use `height2ssbump.exe` to generate this map.

default.name: $ssbumpmathfix
default.description: Modifies the amount of light received

default.name: $surfaceprop
default.description: Sets the physical surface properties to use for this material. This affects sounds and physics like mass and buoyancy.

default.name: $translucent
default.description:
Makes the texture partially see-through. 
Disables projected texture shadow casting and can cause depth sorting problems.

default.name: $treeSway
default.description: Enables the tree-sway effect, which morphs the material according to the level's env_wind to emulate wind blowing through leaves.

default.name: $writez
default.description: Used on the `DecalModulate` shader to force the material to write into z-buffer.

default.name: $mraotexture
default.description:
Used in the PBR shader to represent **M**etallic, **R**oughness and **A**mbient **O**cclusion maps. 

Red: Metallic 

Green: Roughness 

Blue: Ambient Occlusion

default.name: $abovewater
default.description: Whether this material is used for above or below the water’s surface.

default.name: $bottommaterial
default.description: **Required parameter.** This is the material (not texture) to use when underneath the water’s surface. The bottom material must have $reflecttexture, `$abovewater` and `$envmap` disabled, but can otherwise do whatever it wants.

default.name: $underwateroverlay
default.description: Applies a refracting screen overlay when the camera is underwater. Generally used with `effects/water_warp01`. Requires `$abovewater` to be 0.

default.name: $fogenable
default.description: Enables volumetric fog for the water.

default.name: $fogcolor
default.description: Color of the water's volumetric fog. Should match the color used in the `$bottommaterial`

default.name: $fogstart
default.description: Amount of units from the camera that the fog starts. **Warning: Must be 0 for edge fading to work properly.**

default.name: $fogend
default.description: Amount of units from the camera that the fog ends.

default.name: $lightmapwaterfog
default.description: Allows the fog to receive lightmaps, so that static objects can cast shadows onto the water. This must be enabled when the map is compiled.

default.name: $reflecttexture
default.description: Texture to use for reflection. For real-time reflections, use _rt_WaterReflection.

default.name: $reflectamount
default.description: Amount of warp for the reflection. Higher values produce more visible reflections.

default.name: $reflecttint
default.description: Color tint for both expensive and cheap reflections.

default.name: $forceenvmap
default.description: Forces the water to use `$envmap` for reflections.

default.name: $forcecheap
default.description: Force the water to render itself as cheap, regardless of the map's `water_lod_control` entity settings or the user's settings. This will disable real-time reflection and instead use `$envmap`. Refraction is assumed to be opaquely the water fog color.

default.name: $forceexpensive
default.description: Force the water to render itself as expensive, regardless of the map's `water_lod_control` entity settings or the user's settings.

default.name: $cheapwaterstartdistance
default.description: Distance from the eye in inches that the shader should start transitioning to a cheaper water shader.

default.name: $cheapwaterenddistance
default.description: Distance from the eye in inches that the shader should finish transitioning to a cheaper water shader.

default.name: $reflectentities
default.description: Make the water reflect entities. By default, no entities are ever reflected.

default.name: $reflectonlymarkedentities
default.description: Make the water reflect only entities and static props with `Render in Fast Reflections` enabled.

default.name: $reflectskyboxonly
default.description: Make the water reflect only the skybox.

default.name: $reflect2dskybox
default.description: Make the water reflect the skybox material in addition to other reflections.

default.name: $reflect3dskybox
default.description: Make the water reflect the 3D skybox in addition to other reflections. **Requires a `sky_camera` in the map.**

default.name: $nofresnel
default.description: Disable the fresnel on the water's reflection.

default.name: $forcefresnel
default.description: Force this amount of fresnel on the water. Higher values usually cause the water to appear brighter.

default.name: $refract
default.description: Whether the water material should refract.

default.name: $refracttexture
default.description: Texture to use for refraction. For real-time refractions, use `_rt_WaterRefraction`.

default.name: $refractamount
default.description: Amount of warp for the refraction. Higher values produce more warping.

default.name: $refracttint
default.description: Color of the refraction.

default.name: $blurrefract
default.description: Blurs the refraction when underwater. **Only use on materials with `$abovewater 1`

default.name: $pseudotranslucent
default.description: Make the water translucent. This is a cheap substitute for refractive water; do not use this when refraction is enabled.

default.name: $waterblendfactor
default.description: How translucent the water should be when $pseudotranslucent is enabled. At 0, the water is completely transparent, while at 1 the water is completely opaque.

default.name: $scroll1
default.description: Used for flowing water that don't use a flowmap. Refer to the wiki.

default.name: $scroll2
default.description: Used for flowing water that don't use a flowmap. Refer to the wiki.

default.name: $flowmap
default.description: Texture that defines flow velocity by skewing and scrolling the `$normalmap`

default.name: $flow_normaluvscale
default.description: The number of world units covered by the normal map before it repeats. Typically in the 100s.

default.name: $flow_worlduvscale
default.description: The number of times the flow map fits into the material. Face texture scale affects this.

default.name: $flow_uvscrolldistance
default.description: How far along the flow map the normal map should be distorted. Higher values lead to more distortion.

default.name: $flow_timeintervalinseconds
default.description: Time needed for the normal map to cross the `$flow_uvscrolldistance`.

default.name: $flow_timescale
default.description: Modifies flow speed without affecting the amount of distortion.

default.name: $flow_bumpstrength
default.description: How rough the surface of the water is.

default.name: $flow_noise_texture
default.description: A treatment texture used to break up repetition of the normal map.

default.name: $flow_noise_scale
default.description: How many times to fit the noise texture into the normal map. Typically around 0.01.

default.name: $flow_debug
default.description: Replaces the water surface with a literal rendering of the flow map. Don't rely on Hammer's view for alignment.

sourceEngine.shaderParameters.description: All shader parameters used in completition.
